page.title: 06HOUSING
page.content: The area has a mixture of private houses and bungalows,council houses and cottages.There are two housing estates in Gellifor,Maes Hafal and Bodawen.There are 18 council houses in Maes Hafal,some have been bought by the tennants.Bodawen has 16 private houses,two of them still being built.The estate was started about 4-5 years ago. Many of the houses are large,some have been extended or improved so that there is more room to live in them. Some houses have orchards of apple and pear trees. Gellifor is well known locally for damsons and sugar plums. Other housing in the area are farms,scatterd cottages and one or two large country mansions.Some of these are quite old - Plas yn Rhos being one of the oldest in the area dating from the 16th century.
